greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of (1+x)^3/(1+x^3).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,-1).
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} binomial(2n-k-1, k)(-1)^k*3(n-k). - _Paul Barry_, Jan 21 2005
Euler transform of length 6 sequence [3, -3, -1, 0, 0, 1]. - _Michael Somos_, Feb 13 2011
a(n) = -a(-n) = 3 * A128834(n) except a(0) = 1. - _Michael Somos_, Feb 13 2011
a(n) = 3*(n^2 mod 3)*(-1)^floor(n/3), n>0. - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, May 15 2015

The periodic sequence b(n) = a(n+1) has the o.g.f. 3 + G(x) = 3 + 3x(1-x) / (1-x(1-x)) = 3 + 3 L(Cinv(x)) = 3 + 3 x - 3 x^3 - 3 x^4 + ... , where L(x) = x/(1-x) with inverse Linv(x) = x/(1+x) and Cinv(x) = x(1-x), the inverse of the o.g.f. for the shifted Catalan numbers of A000108, C(x) = (1-sqrt(1-4x))/2. Then Ginv(x) = C(Linv(x/3)) = [1 - sqrt[1-4x/(3+x)]]/2. Cf. A267633. - _Tom Copeland_, Jan 25 2016
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[(1 + x)^3/(1 + x^3), {x, 0, 100}], x] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, May 16 2015 *)
program: (MAGMA) I:=[1,3,3]; [n le 3 select I[n] else Self(n-1)-Self(n-2): n in [1..100]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, May 16 2015
results.author: _Paul Barry_, May 15 2003
